metadata.title: CVE-2021-33631 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in openEuler kernel on Linux(filesystem modules) allows Forced Integer Overflow.This issue affectsopenEuler kernel: from 4.19.90 before 4.19.90-2401.3, from 5.10.0-60.18.0before 5.10.0-183.0.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic-64k - 5.15.0-69.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1030-kvm - 5.15.0-1030.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-aws - 5.15.0-1033.37
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1035-azure - 5.15.0-1035.42
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1027-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1027.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-lowlatency - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-69.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1023-nvidia - 5.15.0-1023.23

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1032-oracle - 5.15.0-1032.38
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1007-oem - 6.1.0-1007.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-69.76').
